definition: to care about/to take offense/to mind
to introduce/to lie between/between/shell/armor
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
to not mind (at all, a bit)/to not care in the slightest

sentences.english: Do you mind if I borrow theis newspaper?
sentences.chinese: 你介意我借這份報紙嗎？

sentences.english: Patty minded his ridiculing less when her mother was the butt of it.
sentences.chinese: 如果她爸的嘲笑對象是她媽，帕蒂就不怎麼介意了。

sentences.english: It’s no big deal. I don’t mind helping you out.
sentences.chinese: 這沒什麼大不了的，我不介意幫助你擺脫困境。

sentences.english: Soft but safe Yin Shi Zu, never mind to break up with him.
sentences.chinese: 石柔只求尹祖平安無恙，絕不介意與他分手。

sentences.english: Does it bother you if I stir it with my fingers, old-timer?
sentences.chinese: 介意我用指頭攪拌一下嗎，老傢伙？

sentences.english: The state might not mind trying this again and asking for the death penalty, the judge said.
sentences.chinese: 國家可能不介意再審他一次，判他死刑，法官說。

sentences.english: Sorry. I'm in the middle of something. Would you mind calling back later?.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉。我正在忙一件事。你介意稍後再打來嗎？

sentences.english: I afraid we have no vacant suite room, would you mind having a double room?
sentences.chinese: 我們恐怕沒有空餘的套間了，你介意改定雙人間嗎？

sentences.english: They don’t mind being root-bound and can handle medium light.
sentences.chinese: 他們不介意生根滿盆，也能再光線一般的地方生長。

sentences.english: I can do without your advice, if you don't mind.
sentences.chinese: 要是你不介意，我用不着你的勸告。

sentences.english: But I don’t care if you’re an omnivore.
sentences.chinese: 但是我也不會介意你是否是雜食動物。

sentences.english: Do you care to  give us an example?
sentences.chinese: 您介不介意給我們舉個例子？

sentences.english: They don't mind when it delivers stability and predictability.
sentences.chinese: 他們不介意什麼時候實現穩定性和可預測性。

sentences.english: I don't mind working with other people actually.
sentences.chinese: 實際上我不介意和其他人共事。

sentences.english: Tom doesn't mind that . In fact, he is very pleased .
sentences.chinese: 湯姆不介意那回事，實際上他很高興。

definition: to care about/equivalent of 在於|在于[zai4 yu2]
to pay no attention to/not to mind
to care about/to mind
to be willing to do sth/to be ready to do sth/to be happy to do sth/content/satisfied
to not mind (at all, a bit)/to not care in the slightest
not to care
honestly speaking/to be frank, ...
to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
to care about/to take seriously/to take to heart
to mind/to brood over/to be concerned about
polite/courteous/formal/modest
to have the nerve/what a cheek!/to feel no shame/to overcome the shame/(is it) proper? (rhetorical question)
willingness/would rather (agree to X than Y)
to have misgivings/apprehension/worry/qualm/scruple
to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
